<JD_START>
Job Title: Information Developer-Technical Writer - Remote

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Job Description

Job Description

Information Developer - Technical Writer 1312539

A leading video, audio, and voice technologies company is seeking an Information Developer-Technical Writer. The successful candidate will be responsible for multiple projects' outcomes, emphasizing the agile approach and ensuring all content aligns with our organizational goals. The ideal candidate has an in-depth understanding of XML, DITA, Jira, and agile methodologies. The company offers a great work environment!

Information Developer - Technical Writer Pay and Benefits:

Hourly pay: $55/hr Worksite: Leading audio, video, and voice technologies company (Remote, Candidates must be located in the United States in Central or Eastern Time zone) W2 Employment, Group Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Program 40 hours/week, 3 Month Assignment, Possibility of extension

Information Developer - Technical Writer Responsibilities:

Exhibit profound expertise in curating, generating, and iterating content using tools and standards of XML (DITA experience preferred).Set, manage, and fulfill priorities for 2-3 projects simultaneously, ensuring timely updates and delivery of high-quality outcomes.Operate effectively in SCRUM with daily stand-ups, storytime, and retrospectives.Foster continuous improvement by interpreting and refining practices to enhance the user-focused content.Identify opportunities for innovation and enhance content delivery processes.Collaborate with peers, sharing insights and knowledge for collective growth and innovation.

Information Developer - Technical Writer Qualifications:

5+ years of hands-on experience in user-focused technical content creation. Specific industry experience with audio and visual technology solutions is preferred.Bachelor's degree in Technical Communication, Information Design, or a related field preferred.Prefer experience with UX research of defining and refining user personas, key insights and needs.Mastery over XML, Jira, and other relevant tools. (DITA experience preferred)Comprehensive understanding of UX research, data analytics, and personalization strategies.Proven leadership in multi-project scenarios, showcasing time management and prioritization skills.Superior verbal and written communication, collaboration, and interpersonal abilities.Fluency with tools such as Oxygen XML Editor, Git, Confluence, and the MS Office suite.

this is a remote position

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
